items.question: Insomnia: early hours of the morning

options.text: Waking in early hours of the morning but goes back to sleep
Unable to fall asleep again if he gets out of bed
Thoughts and feelings of incapacity, fatigue, or weakness related to activities, work, or hobbies
Loss of interest in activity, hobbies, or work — either directly reported by patient, or indirect in listlessness, indecision, and vacillation (feels he has to push self to work or activities)
Decrease in actual time spent in activities or decrease in productivity
Stopped working because of present illness

items.question: Psychomotor retardation (slowness of thought and speech; impaired ability to concentrate; decreased motor activity)

options.text: Apprehensive attitude apparent in face or speech

items.question: Anxiety: somatic (physiological concomitants of anxiety such as: gastro-intestinal — dry mouth, wind, indigestion, diarrhea, cramps, belching; cardiovascular — palpitations, headaches; respiratory — hyperventilation, sighs; urinary frequency; sweating)

options.text: Loss of appetite but eating without encouragement from others. Food intake about normal
Difficulty eating without urging. Requests or requires laxatives or medication for bowels or medication for gastro-intestinal symptoms
Heaviness in limbs, back or head. Backaches, headache, muscle aches. Loss of energy and fatigability

items.question: Genital symptoms (such as: loss of libido; menstrual disturbances)

options.text: Frequent complaints, requests for help, etc.

items.question: Loss of weight (rate either A or B)

options.text: Probable weight loss associated with present illness
Admits illness but attributes cause to bad food, climate, overwork, virus, need for rest, etc.
Denies illness but acknowledges having problems
Recognizes illness and acknowledges being mentally ill

recommendation.8-13: Consider monitoring symptoms and stress management techniques.
recommendation.14-18: Seek advice from a healthcare professional.
recommendation.19-22: Strongly consider professional mental health support.
recommendation.≥23: Immediate initiation of professional mental health support and possible pharmacotherapy.
